Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jsp

Class JSPParserFactory

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jsp.JSPParserFactory
public class JSPParserFactory extends Object
Factory for creating JSP parsers and automatically detecting JSP format.

This factory provides convenient methods to parse JSP files without needing to know whether they use traditional JSP syntax or XML format. It automatically detects the format and chooses the appropriate parser.

Usage example: 

 try (InputStream input = new FileInputStream("example.jsp")) {
   JSPPage page = JSPParserFactory.parseJSP(input, "UTF-8", "/example.jsp");
   // Process the parsed JSP page...
 }
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • JSPParserFactory

      public JSPParserFactory(SAXParserFactory saxParserFactory)
      Creates a JSP parser factory with a working SAX parser factory.
      Parameters:
      saxParserFactory - the SAX parser factory that successfully parsed web.xml (may be null)

  • Method Details

    • parseJSP

      public JSPPage parseJSP(InputStream input, String encoding, String jspUri) throws IOException, JSPParseException
      Parses a JSP file, automatically detecting the format and choosing the appropriate parser.
      Parameters:
      input - the input stream containing JSP source bytes
      encoding - the character encoding of the JSP source (e.g., "UTF-8")
      jspUri - the URI/path of the JSP file being parsed (for error reporting)
      Returns:
      a parsed JSP page
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading
      JSPParseException - if parsing fails
      UnsupportedOperationException - if no suitable parser is found

    • parseJSP

      public JSPPage parseJSP(InputStream input, String encoding, String jspUri, JSPPropertyGroupResolver.ResolvedJSPProperties jspProperties) throws IOException, JSPParseException
      Parses a JSP file using the specified resolved JSP properties. This method uses the JSP configuration to determine parsing behaviour, including whether to force XML parsing via the isXml property.
      Parameters:
      input - the input stream containing JSP content
      encoding - the character encoding to use
      jspUri - the URI of the JSP file (for error reporting)
      jspProperties - the resolved JSP properties from configuration
      Returns:
      the parsed JSP page
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      JSPParseException - if the JSP content is malformed

    • createParser

      public JSPParser createParser(JSPParserFactory.ParserType parserType)
      Creates a specific parser by type.
      Parameters:
      parserType - the type of parser to create
      Returns:
      a new parser instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the parser type is unknown

    • registerParser

      public void registerParser(JSPParser parser)
      Registers a custom JSP parser.
      Parameters:

      Unregisters a JSP parser.
      Parameters:

    • getAvailableParsers

      public List<JSPParser> getAvailableParsers()
      Gets a list of all registered parsers.
      Returns:

    • isXmlFormat

      public static boolean isXmlFormat(String filename)
      Checks if a JSP file appears to be in XML format based on filename.
      Parameters:
      filename - the JSP filename
      Returns:
      true if the filename suggests XML format (e.g., .jspx)

    • determineEncoding

      public static String determineEncoding(String contentType)
      Determines the default encoding to use for JSP files.
      Parameters:
      contentType - the content type from page directive, or null
      Returns:
      the encoding to use (defaults to UTF-8)
